text: Amaru Topa Inca, also known as Amaru Inca Yupanqui, () was an Inca prince and co-ruler of the Hanan dynasty, who reigned around 1450. He was the son of Pachacuti and Mama Anawarki. Around 1450, Pachacuti decided to name him his co-ruler and successor. His reign lasted between five and ten years. == References == Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing Category:Inca rulers
title: Amaru Yupanqui
